Package: com.android.build.gradle

[Groovy] Class BasePlugin

    • com.android.build.gradle.BasePlugin

    • Base class for all Android plugins

      • Nested Class Summary

          Nested classes 
          Modifiers Name Description
          static class  BasePlugin.PostCompilationData Class to hold data to setup the many optional post-compilation steps.

        • void createPackagingTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.ApkVariantData variantData, org.gradle.api.Task assembleTask, boolean publishApk)

          Creates the final packaging task, and optionally the zipalign task (if the variant is signed)

          Parameters:
          variantData
          assembleTask - an optional assembleTask to be used. If null a new one is created. The assembleTask is always set in the Variant.
          publishApk - if true the generated APK gets published.

        • void createPostCompilationTasks(@com.android.annotations.NonNull com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.ApkVariantData variantData)

          Creates the post-compilation tasks for the given Variant. These tasks create the dex file from the .class files, plus optional intermediary steps like proguard and jacoco

          Parameters:
          variantData - the variant data.

        • void createProcessJavaResTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.BaseVariantData<? extends com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.BaseVariantOutputData> variantData)

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull void createProguardTasks(@com.android.annotations.NonNull com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.BaseVariantData<? extends com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.BaseVariantOutputData> variantData, @com.android.annotations.Nullable com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.BaseVariantData<? extends com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.BaseVariantOutputData> testedVariantData, @com.android.annotations.NonNull BasePlugin.PostCompilationData pcData)

          Creates the proguarding task for the given Variant.

          Parameters:
          variantData - the variant data.
          testedVariantData - optional. variant data representing the tested variant, null if the variant is not a test variant
          Returns:
          outFile file outputted by proguard

        • void createRenderscriptTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.BaseVariantData<? extends com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.BaseVariantOutputData> variantData)

        • void createSplitAbiTasks(@com.android.annotations.NonNull com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.ApplicationVariantData variantData)

        • void createSplitResourcesTasks(@com.android.annotations.NonNull com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.BaseVariantData<? extends com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.BaseVariantOutputData> variantData)

          Creates the split resources packages task if necessary. AAPT will produce split packages for all --split provided parameters. These split packages should be signed and moved unchanged to the APK build output directory.

          Parameters:
          variantData - the variant configuration.

        • void createTestApkTasks(@com.android.annotations.NonNull com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.TestVariantData variantData)

          Creates the tasks to build the test apk.

          Parameters:
          variantData - the test variant

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull ZipAlign createZipAlignTask(@com.android.annotations.NonNull java.lang.String name, @com.android.annotations.NonNull java.io.File inputFile, @com.android.annotations.NonNull java.io.File outputFile)

          creates a zip align. This does not use convention mapping, and is meant to let other plugin create zip align tasks.

          Parameters:
          name - the name of the task
          inputFile - the input file
          outputFile - the output file
          Returns:
          the task

        • @com.android.annotations.NonNull java.util.Set<java.io.File> getJniFolders(@com.android.annotations.NonNull com.android.build.gradle.internal.variant.ApkVariantData variantData)

          Calculate the list of folders that can contain jni artifacts for this variant.

          Parameters:
          variantData - the variant
          Returns:
          a potentially empty list of directories that exist or not and that may contains native resources.
